Item.Description: Clouddate: August 12. It was a day like any other. The birds were singing. The sun was shining. All seemed well in the world... Until disaster struck! Bjaaaaw, pew pew! Those are the sounds the disaster made whilst striking! It was up to me to save the day! I asked my trusty sidekick, Fire Opal, if she could help me get my cape out of the door. She openly refused on what appeared to be moral grounds, given the ferocity with which she declared herself to be napping, perhaps in recognition of some religious sabbatical. Her sensibilities are still a mystery to me. Perhaps I should inquire about this later, when there are no more disasters.
Item.Name: Cirrus's Diary

Item.Description: The professor sipped gingerly at her ginger tea as she contemplated this new development. Perhaps it was he, and not she, who should be paying for the sheep insurance. After all, if what Pepper had said proved true, it was his idea to begin with that the insurance ought to be purchased at all, and her buyer's remorse was no great secret. After contemplating over this for a small while, she concluded that she would allow her dear coltfriend to take the fall for the whole incident, and smugly began writing a letter to notify the alien biker squid mafia of this new information.
Item.Name: Scribble's Novel

Item.Description: Long strips of cloth wound around the body. A costume to keep you under wraps.

Item.Description: While it may be a cute accessory, this scarf does not taste the least bit peppery. Maybe it's not meant to be eaten...

Item.Description: It's sadly lacking in spears, but this stylish neckwarmer actually does smell faintly of mint.

Item.Description: Finally, a fashionable way to keep your neck as warm as socks keep your hooves!

Item.Description: A just reward received wholly and sweet, as the way it should be this plundered treat, consume this treasure and you shall make haste, for a short burst of speed you shall not waste.
Item.Name: Sweets

Item.Description: A scarf infused with the power of the Prismatic Crystal Shard
Item.Name: Chromatic Scarf

Item.Description: A sweet and juicy fruit.
Item.Name: Mango

Item.Description: The perfect tool for a beginner miner! (Requires Level 1 Mining)
Item.Name: Brass Pickaxe

Item.Description: This can help me mine faster. (Requires Level 10 Mining)
Item.Name: Nickel Pickaxe

Item.Description: A magically hardened gold pickaxe, able to cut through rocks like butter (Requires level 20 Mining)
Item.Name: Gold Pickaxe

Item.Description: A finely-crafted pickaxe from one of the hardest minerals known to ponykind. You'd need to be an experienced miner not to accidentally crush ores with it. (Requires level 30 Mining)
Item.Name: Diamond Pickaxe

Item.Description: A crystal which may or may not reveal the presence of nearby ores, depending on how proficient your metal detecting instincts are.
Item.Name: Dowsing crystal

Item.Description: Admin only - unreleased (Requires Level 35 Mining)
Item.Name: Super pickaxe

Item.Description: A juicy and refreshing fruit that is neither water nor melon. Perfect for hot summers.
Item.Name: Watermelon

Item.Description: A bitter drink with a hint of sweetness, sure to provide that quick burst of energy when you need it.
Item.Name: Coffee

Item.Description: A hot and refreshing drink. Would you believe some ponies enjoy tea cold? The audacity!
Item.Name: Tea

Item.Description: The food of the bees, created from the nectar of flowers, is one of the very few foodstuffs made from a creature.
Item.Name: Honey

Item.Description: A rock which has an affinity to ambient magic. Requires level 36 Farming to grow.
Item.Name: Geode

Item.Description: A cooking recipe for Coffee.
Item.Name: Coffee Recipe

Item.Description: A cooking recipe for Tea.
Item.Name: Tea Recipe

Item.Description: As bright as the sun above. Contains smaller flowers on the ring.
Item.Name: Sunflower

Item.Description: Known for their drooping petals and apparent stigma. Keep away from cats.
Item.Name: Lily

Item.Description: Shaped like a bulb, it can take on many variations.
Item.Name: Tulip

Item.Description: A simple looking flower, yet has a myth involving the beauty of one's own reflection.
Item.Name: Daffodil

Item.Description: Absorbs latent magical energies to produce good pollen, but may appear to be a weed.
Item.Name: Starthistle

Item.Description: Known for its distinct yellow hue. Good for medicinal applications. Makes a great name for a city.
Item.Name: Goldenrod

Item.Description: A dazzling shade of white silver. Known to grow in more hot, dry climates, where the locals grow them for good luck against battles.
Item.Name: Silversword

Item.Description: Sarsparilla! This is the plant known for recipes including drinks and medicine. Not to be mistaken for poison oak.
Item.Name: Sarsparille

Item.Description: This elusive plant has distinct stalks, making it quite lengthy. Can be found in rocky hills.
Item.Name: Feathershank

Item.Description: This hardy flower grows from particular vines. Heard this from the grapevine.
Item.Name: Supplejack

Item.Description: Most bellflowers are known to be shaped like a bell. Having adapted slightly to latent magic, this one isn't.
Item.Name: Bellflower

Item.Description: This ethereal flower takes on an intimidating name despite its translucent beauty. Seeing is believing.
Item.Name: Ghost Flower

Item.Description: This flower is more blue and more bell than the bellflower. Stores a significant pool of mana in its petals and nectar.
Item.Name: Bluebell

Item.Description: Oh snap! This flower takes the appearance of a dragon when squeezed in a particular manner. Having adapted well to its magical environment, this flower harnesses and stores a large pool of this energy.
Item.Name: Snapdragon

Item.Description: Legends say this flower instills warmth and courage in warriors. Don't call this flower 'Sunshine', though, it confuses the other plants.
Item.Name: Moonfire

Item.Description: A multitude of colors radiate from its petals. Checkmate, non-believers: this one is real.
Item.Name: Rainbow Rose

Item.Description: A seed that grows into a daisy over the course of two hours.
Item.Name: Daisy Seed

Item.Description: A seed that grows into a dandelion over the course of two hours.
Item.Name: Dandelion Seed

Item.Description: A seed that grows into a lily over the course of two hours.
Item.Name: Lily Seed

Item.Description: A seed that grows into a tulip over the course of two hours.
Item.Name: Tulip Seed

Item.Description: A seed that grows into a daffodil over the course of two hours.
Item.Name: Daffodil Seed

Item.Name: Ghost Flower Seed

Item.Description: A rare flower seed that grows into Bluebell over the course of two hours.
Item.Name: Bluebell Seed

Item.Name: Snapdragon Seed

Item.Description: A prized flower seed that grows into Moonfire over the course of two hours.
Item.Name: Moonfire Seed

Item.Name: Celery Seed

Item.Description: Grows into Lettuce after two hours when planted.
Item.Name: Lettuce Seed

Item.Description: Grows into Wheat after three hours when planted.
Item.Name: Wheat Seed

Item.Description: Grows into Tomato fruit after three hours when planted.
Item.Name: Tomato Seed

Item.Description: Grows into Strawberry after six hours when planted.
Item.Name: Strawberry Seed

Item.Description: Grows into Cherries after six hours when planted.
Item.Name: Cherry Seed

Item.Description: Grows into Grapes after ten hours when planted.
Item.Name: Grape Seed

Item.Description: Easy-Grow Banana tree sapling sold by an exotic trader. Guaranteed to grow fast into a Banana tree after twelve hours when planted.
Item.Name: Banana Sapling

Item.Description: Produces an Orange tree after thirteen hours of growth.
Item.Name: Orange Seed

Item.Description: Produces a Pear tree after fourteen hours of growth.
Item.Name: Pear Seed

Item.Description: Grows into Watermelon after eight hours when planted.
Item.Name: Watermelon Seed

Item.Description: Produces a Red Apple tree after sixteen hours of growth.
Item.Name: Apple Seed

Item.Description: Produces a Mango tree after eighteen hours of growth.
Item.Name: Mango Seed

Item.Description: More Magic Missiles to attack the darkness with! A mystical concoction which enhances the drinker's magical abilities for up to six minutes. Effect will be lost when traveling.
Item.Name: Arcane Potion

Item.Description: A hearty beverage which increases maximum health for six minutes. Effect will be lost when traveling. For the health conscious.
Item.Name: Vitality Potion

Item.Description: An energetic elixir which increases physical attack for six minutes. Effect will be lost when traveling. There is strength in numbers, and with this potion you become those numbers.
Item.Name: Power Potion

Item.Description: A down-to-earth concoction which increases one's resistance to physical damage for six minutes. Effect will be lost when travelling. Tough effects for a concoction tough to drink.
Item.Name: Toughness Potion

Item.Description: This concoction has managed to get away from scientists for years. A superfluid liquid which raises the chance to avoid most attacks for six minutes. Effect will be lost when traveling.
Item.Name: Elusive Potion

Item.Description: An excitedly heated decoction which raises movement speed for six minutes. Effect will be lost when traveling. I have an immense desire to increase acceleration.
Item.Name: Expeditious Potion

Item.Description: A dense drink which improves resistance magical attacks for six minutes. Effect will be lost when traveling. Easier to drink than it appears.
Item.Name: Warding Potion

Item.Description: A translucent tonic which allows invulnerability for twenty seconds. Drinker cannot deal damage while invulnerable. Effect will be lost when traveling. You canâ€™t see me, the time is now.
Item.Name: Phantom Potion

Item.Description: A high-energy mixture which raises maximum energy for six minutes. Effect will be lost when traveling. Helpful for pulling all-nighters (but do sleep regularly).
Item.Name: Vibrance Potion

Item.Description: A brew specially made to enhance mages in battle. The effects last for six minutes and will be lost when traveling. So much magic is imbued within this brew, it emits its own aura.
Item.Name: Battlemage Potion

Item.Description: Drunk by warriors to boost their combat ability. The effects last for six minutes and will be lost when traveling. RAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARGH!!!
Item.Name: Warrior Potion

Item.Description: Diluted essence of the Rainbow Rose. Who knows what it might do? Tastes spicy.
Item.Name: Flux

Item.Description: Dust made from grinding up sapphires. Holds some residual magical charge, but occasionally used for glowy special effects.
Item.Name: Titanium Corundum Dust

Item.Description: Ground-up emerald. A good magical binder, but occasionally used for glowy special effects.
Item.Name: Beryl Essence

Item.Description: Microscopic diamond fragments which remember their connection to the world. Often used as a catalyst for congealing raw mana.
Item.Name: Kimberlite Essence

Item.Description: Perfect for the spooky season.
Item.Name: Hallowtide Socks (Back Legs)

Item.Description: Perfect for the spooky season.
Item.Name: Hallowtide Socks (Front Legs)

Item.Description: The decadence of these sweet sugars are bound to bring the rowdiness of any swashbuckler. (Please eat responsibly.)
Item.Name: Hallowtide Butterscotch

Item.Description: These lip-puckering candies are likely to take the scurvy out of any scurvy dog.
Item.Name: Hallowtide Sour Drops

Item.Description: No disguising buccaneer would be caught dead without one of these keelhauling bad breath. Wordplay is just as important as combat, so make sure your breath is in tip-top shape.
Item.Name: Hallowtide Humbugs

Item.Description: Blast your taste buds away with these powerful spiced candies. These would make any landlubber walk the plank.
Item.Name: Hallowtide Cannonballs

Item.Description: Candied sugar, honey, butter, vanilla, and more sugar. These sweets are dyed with three distinct colors and molded with wax to resemble corn kernels. No matter where you go, this treat will always be the same.
Item.Name: Hallowtide Candy Corn

Item.Description: Fuzzy replica ears inspired by the intimidating Sphinx. These help you hear those puzzles better.
Item.Name: Sphinx Ears

Item.Description: Front hoofwear designed to be beastly paws of a Sphinx. They even have shaped pads (“toe beans”) on the bottom of these big cat paws.
Item.Name: Sphinx Paws (Front Legs)

Item.Description: Back hoofwear designed to be beastly paws of a Sphinx. They even have shaped pads (“toe beans”) on the bottom of these big cat paws.
Item.Name: Sphinx Paws (Back Legs)

Item.Description: Lightweight, feathery wings like the Sphinx’s wings. No feathered animals were harmed in the making of this accessory.
Item.Name: Sphinx Wings

Item.Description: A rope-like tail with a pointed brushy end designed like the Sphinx’s tail. The belt helps stabilize the tail so you can attack others with your new tail. (Please don’t.)
Item.Name: Sphinx Tail

Item.Description: Headwear based on the one adorned by the great Sphinx. It’s metallic design replicates the sheen and shine of the real crown.
Item.Name: Sphinx Crown

Item.Description: Patterned cloth based on the same collar adorned by the mighty Sphinx. The colors in the middle and outer layers of the collar pattern can be changed at will from its wearer.
Item.Name: Sphinx Collar

Item.Description: Breezy bodywear made to look ethereal like the fabled Windigoes. Despite the design, the actual clothing keeps you well insulated.
Item.Name: Windigo Body

Item.Description: A hair wig made to copy the flowing mane of a Windigo. Your real mane is fine, it’s protected under this accessory.
Item.Name: Windigo Mane

Item.Description: Fake ears designed to replicate the elongated ears of a donkey. Despite their size, these costume ears do not improve hearing.
Item.Name: Donkey Ears

Item.Description: A muzzle made to simulate the nose of a donkey. The materials used allow the wearer to breathe through the muzzle.
Item.Name: Donkey Nose

Item.Description: A ropey tail with a brush-like end designed to be like a donkey’s tail. It attaches from the back with a belt and is much longer than a real donkey tail.
Item.Name: Donkey Tail

Item.Description: A branch-like horn resembling the Kirin’s horn. This horn takes on more of a deer-like appearance than a unicorn horn.
Item.Name: Kirin Horn

Item.Description: Deer-like ears made to look like the mythical Kirin. It’s a mystery how they are so fluffy.
Item.Name: Kirin Ears

Item.Description: A flowy mane imitating the majestic Kirin. What’s their secret to such a luscious mane? Maybe they’re just born with it.
Item.Name: Kirin Mane

Item.Description: A tail more extravagant compared to an ox’s tail, this Kirin tail replica accentuates the lavish tail with the inclusion of the tail hairs.
Item.Name: Kirin Tail

Item.Description: Front hoofwear designed to be beastly paws of a Manticore. They even have shaped pads (“toe beans”) for these lion paws.
Item.Name: Kirin Feet (Front Legs)

Item.Description: Back hoofwear designed to be beastly paws of a Manticore. They even have shaped pads (“toe beans”) for these lion paws.
Item.Name: Kirin Feet (Back Legs)

Item.Description: A dress inspired by a world dedicated to steam. This ergonomic design allows the wearer to look fancy and to adapt in working conditions.
Item.Name: Travious Dress

Item.Description: Shoes worn within a world dedicated to steam. A comfortably tight fit allows hoof safety from the harshest of conditions to the fanciest of parties.
Item.Name: Travious Boots

Item.Description: Blank item
Item.Name: Wayward's Necklace

Item.Description: Replica teeth matching the ferocious Manticore’s fangs. These teeth are not made to bite or chew with, they are purely cosmetic.
Item.Name: Manticore Fangs
